title: After setting up Local Folders and subfolders to keep important emails and using message filters to transfer emails automatically, now I can't edit filters
content:
I started using Local Folders to store emails I want to keep. In particular, I subscribe to several email newsletters. I created a sub-folder under Local Folders called " Subscriptions". Under subscriptions I made sub folders for each of the subscriptions. Then I made Message Filters for each subscription. The filters are generally working. What is not working is editing the filters if there was a glitch in the transfer of the newsletter from its email origin to the subscriptions sub-folder. When I go into Message Filters and look for the folder under filters, it isn't there. In fact none of the filters for the subscriptions shows up in the Message Filters page.

The first of the two images below shows all the sub-folders from my first email account. The second image shows what happens when I look for sub-folders under Local Folders (and then, of course, the sub-folders of the sub-folders. The local sub-folders showed up when I created them and message filters. I was able to find the sub-folders one other time, but I honestly don't know how I did it.

Two things: On that otherwise blank page (2nd image) if I search folder in the search bar, nothing happens. Two, I have not yet deleted the original subfolders from the emails accounts. That could be a problem?

Any help appreciated
creator: bdjim

title: Cannot connect Yahoo email to Thunderbird client
content:
Hi,

I've recently tried connecting my Yahoo account to my Thunderbird client (102.12.0 (64-bit) on Windows 10 but it refuses to connect. I add the account and use the recommended settings, I get through entering my email, password, checking I am not a bot, and autheniticating using an app but then it just reverts back to asking me to entering my email again (screen shot 1) and never connects.

I have a VPN but the issue remains when it is turned off. I have also tried logging in to my email in Firefox and this works fine so there's no issue with the credentials at all. The settings are the standard (second screen shot)

Can you advise please as this is my main email address and I'd like it working, as has done for years, in Thunderbird.

Many thanks

[EDIT] Antivirus was the cause. Had to add exceptions for https://mail.yahoo.com and https://login.yahoo.com in my antivirus settings to finally get access
creator: oobersmardon

title: sending mails via TB does not work
content:
Dear mozilla helper, I use the TB version 102.12.0 (32-bit). Since today I cannot send any mails. There is always a prompt to enter the password again, when I click on "try again" nothing new happens. When I click on "enter new password" the window closes briefly and then reappears (I suspect TB is making a new attempt to send). When I click on Cancel, the following message appears: Sending message failed. Authentication with the SMTP server smtp.office365.com failed. Please check the password and the selected "Authentication method" under "Account settings | Outgoing mail server (SMTP)". My outgoing server is: smtp.office365.com Port: 587 Connection security: STARTTLS Authentication method: OAuth2

Since I had problems using my office365 accounts in TB a while ago, I set the flag: network.dns.disableIPv6 = true in the configurations as described here (https://www.borncity.com/blog/2023/01/02/thunderbird-oauth-imap-verbindungsproblem-mit-exchange-online-outlook-office365-com/) and my administrator authorized TB.

Looking for a fix I landed on this page and did the steps under 2. there. Without success. https://support.mozilla.org/de/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202 Can you help me?

Kind regards,

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
creator: allusernamesalreadyexist

title: Thunderbird - looses cursor focus after about 4 seconds

title: Email display snaps to top when switching between message windows
content:
I frequently have two or three emails open in different windows whose content I would like to compare. However, each time I switch between windows, the display snaps to the top of the message rather than displaying the portion of the email I was previously viewing. That makes comparison somewhere between difficult and impossible.

Is there any way to change this behavior such that when I switch to a message I was previously viewing, I see what was displayed when I switched away from that window?

title: Spent days setting up EXCHANGE account in Thunderbird, closed Chrome, new account disappeared with all emails in it
content:
I am distressed. I've used Thunderbird for years and had to create a new version of my IMAP account using EXCHANGE. I did that. I know it was successful because the EXCHANGE account showed up in Thunderbird and I then spent days transferring emails from the old IMAP account personal email folders into duplicate folders in the new EXCHANGE account.

Then today I closed my browser. When I re-opened Thunderbird, the new EXCHANGE account was absent. Since I can't use the old IMAP account any more, I tried again to create an EXCHANGE account. When I tried to do that, I got a message that "the server already exists" (see image below) and I am unable to complete the task.

So the previously created EXCHANGE account has disappeared, with all my emails in it, I can't create a new one, and the IMAP no longer works (and won't accept my password to send or receive). I feel completely stuck and I've lost several years of emails.

The fact that the message said that the server already exists makes me think and hope that my EXCHANGE account still exists somewhere. Can you help me find it? Many thanks in advance. Steve
creator: steve.ross.karuna

title: Thunderbird not asking for password, can't get mail
content:
Tonight I accidentally mistyped my password upon starting Thunderbird, so I chose "enter new password" and retyped it correctly. But now it won't download my mail, and I can't find any way to try entering the password again. (My password is not saved.) When I click "Get messages" the blue progress bar flickers at the bottom of the screen briefly but the Activity Manager remains blank. No mail is downloaded and there are no progress messages. There is also a small "null" note at bottom left, not sure whether that's related.

I have tried restarting Thunderbird several times, and restarting my computer entirely. No difference. I went into Settings / Privacy and Security and confirmed that there is no password saved. None of the settings have been changed. But I'm not getting an error message when I try to download mail, it's not doing anything at all (aside from the brief flicker of the progress bar).

I tried sending a test message and got the error "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.theworld.com failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again." But none of my settings have changed. I can access my mail via web server so there isn't a problem with the ISP. But answering mail that way is really clumsy and time-consuming. I need my Thunderbird!

I am using Thunderbird 102.12.0 with Windows 10 Pro. I have been a happy Thunderbird user for many years (since 2015 I think) and have never encountered this problem before. I really hope you can tell me how to solve it, I am aware of several time-sensitive messages in my mailbox and I can't download anything. Thanks very much for your time!
creator: elkatd

title: TB 115.0b2 Deleted emails do not go to Trash
content:
I have Thunderbird 115.0b2 installed and using unified folders. When I delete a message from my inbox or even any of my local folders, the deleted message does not move to my Trash folder. Basically, the email is gone. I looked through all the various TB settings and cannot find any that would cause this action. I really want the deleted emails to go into the Trash folder in case I make an error deleting the wrong email one day. Any suggestions are welcome.

Thank you, Steve
creator: rino1222

title: Copia de seguridad de los correos en Thunderbird
content:
Tengo muy poco espacio (cuota de almacenamiento) en el servidor de correo. Habitualmente voy eliminando en el servidor, a través del Webmail, todos aquellos correos que no me importan. Estos correos van a la papelera y también la vacío. Hasta ahí todo bien porque al sincronizar también se eliminan en local. El problema surge cuando, para ganar espacio, tengo que eliminar en el servidor correos que no quiero perder, porque también se pierden en local y esto es lo que quiero evitar. Lo he intentado pero no veo como hacer la copia de seguridad, ni donde se guardaría. Las respuestas que he encontrado hasta ahora de otras consultas, no he podido o sabido aplicarlas. Manualmente no veo como hacerlo, a no ser correo a correo, lo que es muy poco práctico. Además necesito en un primer paso archivar una gran cantidad de correos antiguos que están en las carpetas anuales de la carpeta Archivos.

Gracias por vuestra ayuda
creator: markko003
